thread.title: Casey, O’Connor talk up boxing rematch on BHR
thread.title_full: Casey, O’Connor talk up boxing rematch on BHR | Boston Herald

author: Zuri Berry
title: Casey, O’Connor talk up boxing rematch on BHR
text:
Ken Casey, lead singer for the Dropkick Murphys and a fight promoter, joined boxer Danny O’Connor (26-2) on Boston Herald Radio’s “Sweeney & Malone” program to talk about O’Connor’s fight tomorrow with Gabriel Bracero (23-2).
The fight, with an undercard slate set to start at 6 p.m., will be the main event broadcast on NBC Sports Network at the Lowell Memorial Auditorium.
It’ll be a rematch for O’Connor, a Framingham native, and Bracero, who won their last fight by a decision in 2011.
“The first fight was definitely not my night in the office and I lost every round of the fight,” O’Connor said.
Bracero, who joined the interview by phone, hailed his New York roots to promote the fight.
“It’ll be a fun thing to bring that into the ring,” Bracero said. “I know Danny’s out here representing his people, his town. ... This New York and Massachusetts rivalry, we’re gonna take it to another level over here and make it a fun and exciting thing Saturday night.”
